016
017package org.parboiled.examples.abc;
018
019import org.parboiled.common.StringUtils;
020import org.parboiled.errors.ErrorUtils;
021import org.parboiled.parser.Parboiled;
022import org.parboiled.parserunners.ReportingParseRunner;
023import org.parboiled.support.ParsingResult;
024import org.parboiled.parserunners.ReportingParseRunner;
025import org.parboiled.support.ParseTreeUtils;
026import org.parboiled.support.ParsingResult;
027
028import java.util.Scanner;
029
030import static org.parboiled.support.ParseTreeUtils.printNodeTree;
031
032public class Main {
033
034    public static void main(String[] args) {
035        AbcParser parser = Parboiled.createParser(AbcParser.class);
036
037        while (true) {
038            System.out.print("Enter an a^n b^n c^n expression (single RETURN to exit)!\n");
039            String input = new Scanner(System.in).nextLine();
040            if (StringUtils.isEmpty(input)) break;
041
042            ParsingResult<?> result = new ReportingParseRunner(parser.S()).run(input);
043
044            if (!result.parseErrors.isEmpty())
045                System.out.println(ErrorUtils.printParseError(result.parseErrors.get(0)));
046            else
047                System.out.println(ParseTreeUtils.printNodeTree(result) + '\n');
048        }
049    }
050
051}
